name: skittery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
moving very quickly and lightly, or in a way that is unexpected or irregular: The tune is skittery modern jazz. We could see black-and-white skittery flashes of birds in the trees.
nervous or easily frightened: Julie was riding a skittery horse. They pushed me up against the horses, which became skittery. Her skittery behaviour could be quite charming at times. Synonym
skittish
More examplesFewer examplesShe has a speedy, skittery conversational style.The steering made turns smooth and not the least bit skittery.The violinist's tone was often skittery and erratic, especially in the quieter passages.
